intro: Lipochaeta fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered leaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in a dense inflorescence. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Lipochaeta fasciculata is drought-tolerant and has adapted to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
